questions.questionText: 1. 1. Was a S2D session held before you start the project execution?
1. 2. Are there refresh contractual awareness sessions to the Delivery teams to update them on the contractual changes (CRs, amendments, new SOWs, ...)?
2. 1. Do you have the contract and all the correlated contractual documents?
2. 2. Are the contract and all the correlated contractual documents stored in e-Collaborative?
2. 3. Are the contract and all the correlated contractual documents signed?
2. 4. Did you read the contract and all the correlated contractual documents?
2. 5. In case you have any doubt on the understanding of the contract and all the correlated contractual documents, did you ask for CCM support?
2. 6. In case of specific and non usual demands from the client (e.g.: audit, benchmarking, COVID, ...), did you request the support from CCM?
3. 1. Is engagement management documentation stored in e-Collaborative?
3. 2. Are client status report and minutes of client meetings being systematically created, formalizing the main problems of the project?

3. 3. Are the problems (non related to Capgemini) and breach of obligations/assumptions being formalized to the client (via email, notification), in order to maximize our position in future negotiations?
3. 4. Is the "wording" used in our documents protecting Capgemini from (i) misinterpretation and/or (ii) putting the client in a favorable position to claim anything against Capgemini?
3. 5. Is there a systematic process in place to ensure the collection and storage of the documents of the team leaving the project (e.g: attrition)?
4. 1. Is the governance defined in the contract being systematically used (frequency of meetings, escalation, participants, formalization of the decisions, ...)?
5. 1. Are the services starting only after a respective service order is open?
5. 2. Is the clause for confirming or refusing a service order being applied?
6. 1. Are you getting all the necessary acceptance terms, as per defined in the contract?
6. 2. Is the acceptance criteria for each deliverable being respected?
6. 3. Is the client providing the acceptance terms within the the defined contractual period?

6. 4. In case (i) the client is not providing the acceptance terms within the defined contractual period, and (ii) the contract contains a clause for deemed acceptance, are you using this clause to enforce the process of acceptance and invoicing?
6. 5. In case there is a clause allowing Capgemini to receive partial acceptance of deliverables not in dispute, are you using this clause to enforce the respective invoice?
6. 6. In case there are delays in Capgemini's activities due to dependencies from the client, did you escalate and formalize the problem using the contractual governance process?
7. 1. Is the clause to review the volume band/baseline of tickets being properly applied, as per the frequency defined in the contract?
7. 2. Are the rules for ARCs (Additional Resource Charge) and RRCs (Reduced Resource Charge) being properly applied?
8. 1. Are the milestones being invoiced as planned in the contract?
8. 2. In case there are services that were suspended or cancelled after have been initiated, were they invoiced (if allowed by the contract)?
8. 3. Are the invoices being issued respecting the agreed dates and having all the necessary information/documentation?
8. 4. Is the client paying within the term defined in the contract?
8. 5. In case the client delays the payment, are the penalties being pushed towards the client?
8. 6. Did you invoice the overtime hours?
8. 7. Did you invoice the extra baseline?
8. 8. Did you invoice the expenses?
9. 1. Is there a tool to manage the SLAs?
9. 2. If there is a tool, is it measuring the SLAs correctly?
9. 3. Is the contractual process to apply a penalty being correctly applied?
9. 4. Is the contractual process to apply a SLA being correctly applied?
9. 5. Is the contractual process to apply a Bonus (Earn Back) being correctly applied?
9. 6. In case the penalty and/or the SLA is being applied, is the contractual cap being respected?
9. 7. Did you use the clause to review the SLAs as per the rules defined in the contract (if applicable)?
9. 8. Are you using the relief clause to avoid penalties?
10. 1. Is COLA being applied?
10. 2. In case there was a change in tax legislation, did you charge it from the client?
10. 3. In case there are certain obligations and/or assumptions (under client's responsibility) necessary to be accomplished to apply a contractual price reduction: have they been accomplished?
10. 4. In case these obligations and/or assumptions were not accomplished, did you escalate and formalize the problem using the contractual governance provision?
10. 5. In case (i) there were planned some automation to reduce Capgemini's cost and (ii) there are dependencies from client: have they been accomplished?
10. 6. In case these dependencies were not accomplished, did you escalate and formalize the problem using the contractual governance provision?
11. 1. Did you follow the contractual process with the client to use subcontractors?
11. 2. Do you have the respective contracts with the suppliers?
11. 3. Are the contracts with the suppliers stored in e-Collaborative?
11. 4. Are the contracts with the suppliers signed?
11. 5. Did you read the contracts with the suppliers?
11. 6. In case you have any doubt on the understanding of the contracts with the suppliers, did you ask for CCM support?
11. 7. Is the contractual process to accept the subcontractor's invoice being respected?
11. 8. Is the supplier being penalyzed as per the rules of the contract?
11. 9. Did you formalize to the subcontractor the issues caused by it?
11. 10. In case Capgemini is penalized by the client due to a problem originally caused by the subcontractor, did you pass the penalty to it (if feasible by the contract)?
11. 11. Are you respecting the maximum amount to be paid to the subcontractor?
11. 12. In case there are discounts planned in the contract (e.g.: depending on volumes, ...), are they being applied?
12. 1. Is the contractual process to trigger a change request being respected?
12. 2. Are the services related to a change request getting started only after the respective CR is signed?

12. 3. In case there is a decision from Capgemini to not charge a change request, is this information being shared with the client (preferably, formalized)? This could be used in future negotiations...
12. 4. Are the rates defined in the contract being used to price the CR?
13. 1. Was the transition plan timely delivered to the client?
13. 2. In case the client has decided to early terminate the contract by convenience, did it notify Capgemini as per the rules of the contract?
13. 3. In case the client has decided to early terminate the contract by convenience, were the contractual penalties applied?
13. 4. In case there is a decision to renew and/or extend the original contract, was an amendment negotiated and signed?
14. 1. In case of more complex disputes/negotiations, did you engage CCM to support you?
